carousel.title: Munnar
carousel.description: A popular hill station known for its sprawling tea plantations, scenic landscapes, and cool climate.

carousel.title: Guruvayur Temple
carousel.description: An important pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Krishna, attracting devotees from all over India.

carousel.title: Sabarimala Sree Ayyappa Temple
carousel.description: One of the most renowned pilgrimage sites in India, dedicated to Lord Ayyappa and situated amidst the dense forests of the Western Ghats.

carousel.title: Fort Kochi
carousel.description: A historic neighborhood known for its colonial architecture, charming streets, and the famous Chinese Fishing Nets.

carousel.title: Alleppey Backwaters
carousel.description: The intricate network of canals, rivers, and lakes offers a tranquil and picturesque cruising experience on traditional houseboats.

districts.title: Alappuzha
districts.description: Known for its backwaters and houseboats.
districts.long_description: Alappuzha, also known as Alleppey, is renowned for its picturesque backwaters, tranquil houseboat cruises, and vibrant boat races.

places_to_visit.name: Alleppey Backwaters
places_to_visit.description: The intricate network of canals, rivers, and lakes offers a tranquil and picturesque cruising experience on traditional houseboats.

places_to_visit.name: Alappuzha Beach
places_to_visit.description: A popular tourist destination known for its beautiful sunsets and a historic lighthouse, making it a perfect spot for a leisurely evening.

places_to_visit.name: Krishnapuram Palace
places_to_visit.description: An 18th-century palace known for its stunning architecture, murals, and the largest mural painting in Kerala, 'Gajendra Moksha'.

places_to_visit.name: Pathiramanal Island
places_to_visit.description: A small island in the Vembanad Lake, known for its rich avian population, attracting bird watchers and nature lovers.

districts.title: Ernakulam
districts.long_description: Ernakulam, located in the heart of Kochi, is a bustling city known for its vibrant commercial activities and historical significance.

places_to_visit.name: Fort Kochi
places_to_visit.description: A historic neighborhood known for its colonial architecture, charming streets, and the famous Chinese Fishing Nets.

places_to_visit.name: Marine Drive
places_to_visit.description: A scenic waterfront promenade offering stunning views of the backwaters and the sunset, popular for evening walks.

places_to_visit.name: Jew Town
places_to_visit.description: A vibrant area known for its spice markets, antique shops, and the historic Paradesi Synagogue, the oldest active synagogue in the Commonwealth.

places_to_visit.name: Mangalavanam Bird Sanctuary
places_to_visit.description: A green haven in the heart of the city, home to a variety of bird species and mangrove vegetation, offering a peaceful retreat.

districts.title: Idukki
districts.description: Famous for hill stations and wildlife sanctuaries.
districts.long_description: Idukki district is known for its breathtaking hill stations, lush greenery, and abundant wildlife.

places_to_visit.name: Munnar
places_to_visit.description: A popular hill station known for its sprawling tea plantations, scenic landscapes, and cool climate.

places_to_visit.name: Eravikulam National Park
places_to_visit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its population of the endangered Nilgiri Tahr and diverse flora and fauna.

places_to_visit.name: Idukki Dam
places_to_visit.description: One of Asia's highest arch dams, offering spectacular views of the surrounding hills and the reservoir.

places_to_visit.name: Thekkady
places_to_visit.description: Home to the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, offering opportunities for wildlife spotting, boat cruises, and nature walks.

districts.title: Kannur
districts.description: Known for its beaches and Theyyam rituals.
districts.long_description: Kannur district is renowned for its pristine beaches, cultural heritage, and vibrant Theyyam rituals.

places_to_visit.name: Payyambalam Beach
places_to_visit.description: Enjoy the golden sands and scenic views at Payyambalam Beach.

places_to_visit.name: Thalassery Fort
places_to_visit.description: Explore the historical Thalassery Fort and learn about its colonial past.

districts.title: Kasaragod
districts.description: Famous for its forts and temples.
districts.long_description: Kasaragod district is known for its ancient forts, scenic landscapes, and sacred temples.

places_to_visit.name: Bekal Fort
places_to_visit.description: Visit the historic Bekal Fort, with its stunning views of the Arabian Sea.

places_to_visit.name: Ananthapura Lake Temple
places_to_visit.description: Explore the unique Ananthapura Lake Temple known for its vegetarian crocodile.

districts.title: Kollam
districts.description: Known for its cashew processing and Ashtamudi Lake.
districts.long_description: Kollam district is famous for its cashew processing industry, serene backwaters, and historic significance.

places_to_visit.name: Ashtamudi Lake
places_to_visit.description: A vast and serene lake known for its picturesque houseboat cruises and rich biodiversity.

places_to_visit.name: Thangassery Light House
places_to_visit.description: A historic lighthouse offering panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and the Kollam cityscape.

places_to_visit.name: Kollam Beach
places_to_visit.description: A tranquil beach with golden sands, perfect for relaxation, evening walks, and enjoying the sunset.

places_to_visit.name: Palaruvi Waterfalls
places_to_visit.description: A stunning waterfall cascading from about 300 feet, surrounded by lush greenery, ideal for picnics and a refreshing dip.

districts.title: Kottayam
districts.description: Famous for its rubber plantations and literacy.
districts.long_description: Kottayam district is renowned for its rubber plantations, vibrant literary culture, and scenic landscapes.

places_to_visit.name: Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary
places_to_visit.description: A bird watcher's paradise, located on the banks of Vembanad Lake, home to a variety of resident and migratory birds.

places_to_visit.name: Ettumanoor Mahadeva Temple
places_to_visit.description: An ancient Shiva temple known for its Kerala-style architecture, vibrant murals, and annual festival.

places_to_visit.name: Vembanad Lake
places_to_visit.description: The largest lake in Kerala, offering serene boat rides, fishing, and bird watching opportunities.

places_to_visit.name: Illikkal Kallu
places_to_visit.description: A popular trekking destination offering panoramic views of the Western Ghats and a thrilling trekking experience.

districts.title: Kozhikode
districts.description: Known for its historical significance and cuisine.
districts.long_description: Kozhikode district is famed for its rich history, cultural heritage, and delectable Malabar cuisine.

places_to_visit.name: Kozhikode Beach
places_to_visit.description: A serene beach with golden sands, known for its beautiful sunsets and a historic lighthouse.

places_to_visit.name: Beypore
places_to_visit.description: A coastal town famous for its traditional shipbuilding industry and scenic beach, offering insights into ancient craftsmanship.

places_to_visit.name: Mananchira Square
places_to_visit.description: A historic park in the city center, surrounded by important landmarks and offering a tranquil space for relaxation.

places_to_visit.name: Kappad Beach
places_to_visit.description: A historic beach where Vasco da Gama first landed in 1498, known for its scenic beauty and historical significance.

districts.title: Malappuram
districts.description: Famous for its cultural heritage and festivals.
districts.long_description: Malappuram district is renowned for its rich cultural heritage, vibrant festivals, and religious diversity.

places_to_visit.name: Kodikuthimala
places_to_visit.description: Trek through the scenic hills of Kodikuthimala and enjoy breathtaking views.

places_to_visit.name: Kottakkunnu
places_to_visit.description: Visit the Kottakkunnu hilltop park for panoramic views of the city.

places_to_visit.name: Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary
places_to_visit.description: A picturesque bird sanctuary located on the estuary of the Kadalundi River, home to a variety of resident and migratory birds.

places_to_visit.name: Nilambur Teak Museum
places_to_visit.description: The world's first teak museum, offering comprehensive information on the history and cultivation of teak, surrounded by teak plantations.

districts.title: Palakkad
districts.description: Known as the granary of Kerala.
districts.long_description: Palakkad district is known as the granary of Kerala due to its extensive paddy fields and agricultural productivity.

places_to_visit.name: Palakkad Fort
places_to_visit.description: A well-preserved fort built by Hyder Ali in 1766, offering historical insights and panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

places_to_visit.name: Silent Valley National Park
places_to_visit.description: A biodiversity hotspot and part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve, home to endangered species and offering trekking and nature walk opportunities.

places_to_visit.name: Malampuzha Dam
places_to_visit.description: A popular picnic spot near the Western Ghats, featuring beautiful gardens, a rock garden, and an amusement park.

places_to_visit.name: Parambikulam Wildlife Sanctuary
places_to_visit.description: A scenic sanctuary on the Kerala-Tamil Nadu border, known for its rich biodiversity and offering wildlife safaris, trekking, and camping.

districts.title: Pathanamthitta
districts.description: Famous for pilgrimage sites and festivals.
districts.long_description: Pathanamthitta district is famous for its religious significance, vibrant festivals, and scenic landscapes.

places_to_visit.name: Sabarimala Sree Ayyappa Temple
places_to_visit.description: One of the most renowned pilgrimage sites in India, dedicated to Lord Ayyappa and situated amidst the dense forests of the Western Ghats.

places_to_visit.name: Perunthenaruvi Waterfall
places_to_visit.description: A scenic waterfall on the banks of the Pamba River, popular for picnics and nature walks.

places_to_visit.name: Gavi
places_to_visit.description: A picturesque village in the Western Ghats, known for its wildlife, trekking trails, and beautiful landscapes.

places_to_visit.name: Aranmula
places_to_visit.description: A cultural hub famous for its traditional boat races and Aranmula Kannadi (metal mirrors).

districts.title: Thiruvananthapuram
districts.long_description: Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of Kerala, is known for its rich cultural heritage, historic monuments, and beautiful beaches.

places_to_visit.name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple
places_to_visit.description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known for its architectural grandeur and religious significance.

places_to_visit.name: Kovalam Beach
places_to_visit.description: A world-renowned beach known for its crescent-shaped shoreline, pristine waters, and vibrant nightlife.

places_to_visit.name: Napier Museum
places_to_visit.description: Established in the 19th century, this museum houses a vast collection of archaeological and historical artifacts.

places_to_visit.name: Ponmudi
places_to_visit.description: A hill station near the city, offering stunning views of the Western Ghats, trekking trails, and a cool climate.

districts.title: Thrissur
districts.description: Cultural capital of Kerala, known for Thrissur Pooram.
districts.long_description: Thrissur district is the cultural capital of Kerala, renowned for its vibrant festivals, traditional arts, and historic temples.

places_to_visit.name: Vadakkunnathan Temple
places_to_visit.description: An ancient Shiva temple known for its magnificent architecture and the annual Thrissur Pooram festival.

places_to_visit.name: Thrissur Zoo
places_to_visit.description: Explore the Thrissur Zoo and witness a variety of wildlife species.

places_to_visit.name: Athirappilly Waterfalls
places_to_visit.description: A breathtaking waterfall often referred to as the 'Niagara of India', located amidst lush greenery.

places_to_visit.name: Guruvayur Temple
places_to_visit.description: An important pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Krishna, attracting devotees from all over India.

districts.title: Wayanad
districts.description: Famous for its scenic beauty and wildlife.
districts.long_description: Wayanad district is renowned for its lush green landscapes, mist-clad hills, and diverse wildlife.

places_to_visit.name: Edakkal Caves
places_to_visit.description: Explore the ancient Edakkal Caves known for their Neolithic petroglyphs.

places_to_visit.name: Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary
places_to_visit.description: Discover the rich biodiversity of Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary.
